1�You open the tome to the ??Moogle's Almanack?? chapter and peruse its weather prognostication pages.
1�Close observation of the sky reveals that the weather in this area today will be ????.
1�Close observation of the sky reveals that the weather in this area today will be ????. There is also the possibility of ????, so caution is in order.
1�Close observation of the sky reveals that the weather in this area today will be ???? with a chance of ????.
1�Close observation of the sky reveals that the weather in this area today will be ???? with occasional ????. There is also a slight chance of ????, so caution is in order.
1�Predicting ahead, tomorrow's weather looks to be ????.
1�Predicting ahead, tomorrow's weather looks to be ????. There is also the possibility of ????, so caution is in order.
1�Predicting ahead, tomorrow's weather looks to be ???? with a chance of ????.
1�Predicting ahead, tomorrow's weather looks to be ???? with occasional ????. There is also a slight chance of ????, so caution is in order.
1�Finally, the forecast for the day after tomorrow calls for ????.
1�Finally, the forecast for the day after tomorrow calls for ????. There is also the possibility of ????, so caution is advised.

1�Exit? (You cannot reenter here.)Yes.Not now.
1�Use the 3?????Yes.No.
1�You ring the red bell and hear the dull sound of something being unlocked.
1�Leave through the gate?Yes.No.
1�Oh my Gob! You're one of those adventurerurers, aren't ya?You got nothin' on me, ?[man./lady.] I was just mindin' my own businesesess, lookin' for junk an' stuff.
1�Hey, watch out. You don't wanna fight me. I'll turn you into meat jerky!Wait, how about you and me be friends instead? Sound good?
1�I travel all over the world and hear lots of differererent stories. I even hear your stories. I can tell you one, if you want.
1�Do you want to hear a story?No, thank you.Let's hear one.

1�What story would you like to be told?On second thought, maybe later.Get the Picture.Give Peace a Chance.Two Horn the Savage(pt.1).Two Horn the Savage(pt.2).Moment of Truth.The Prince and the Hopper(pt.1).The Prince and the Hopper(pt.2).The Prince and the Hopper(pt.3).The Prince and the Hopper(pt.4).The Prince and the Hopper(pt.5).
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Now, listen close...
1�I cannot...To the boss, I will not give you.You run. Run far from here.
1�Fine, I will be.A mighty beastman, Gukool Ja is. Of worry, you have no need.
1�Now, go. Quickly.
1�Wrong, war is.Let go, I will not.Wrong, your ideas are!
1�Forget you, we will not.We.
..�Forget, I will not.I.
..�Friend...You...I.
1�What...?But what about you?
1�Waa
1�This is the way it had to be.But I will not have you bringing children into this.
1�Very well.I will overlook it this one time.
1�We have more important things to worry about.My superiors have begun to notice our activities.
1�I spread rumors of Isween's nightly meetings to divert attention, but it would be best if we avoided contact for a time.
1�Did you find them!?
1�These are their weapons! And look at all these footprints... Could they have taken everyone to the Jade Sepulcher?
1�We must hurry!
1�Gukool Ja!You're injured!
..�No!Stay with me, Gukool Ja!
1�Gukool Ja!
a!�Soft, you still are.Ideas of peace, you must let go.
1�Wrong...!?Your own ideas, you keep.One like you, we do not need.
1�Only to test Gukool Ja, we wished.Free to go, the child is.
1�Understood. Careful, we will be.
1�War, I want to end.Boss, I want to stop.
1�Stop boss, we cannot.End war, we cannot.Why...
1�Meeting you, I remember.That day, I remember...
1�You and I, the fighting, could not stop...Sorry, I am...
1�Whoa! There you are!
1�Running will do you no goody-wood! I'm gonna get you!
1�He wasn't a Mamool Ja... He was a person dressy-wessed up as a Mamool Ja!
1�Come to thinky-wink of it, I did hear something about a liquid that will turn any who drinky-winks of it into the form of a resident of Mamook...
1�But by the looky-wooks of him...Who are you, anyway?
1�Are you the one who made mille feuille out of the guards?...Would you happy-wappen to be Duuruhn?
1�Explain yourself!
1�Doubts?
1�That's true. Empress Nashmeira receives a lot of crity-witicism for that.
1�So you decidey-wided to transform into a Mamool Ja until everyone forgot about you.
1�Interesting. Not that baddy-wad of a plan.
1�Two Horn...doesn't exist?
1�Hmph, that shows how little-wittle you know.
1�Two Horn is standy-wanding right in front of you!
1�I heardy-weard that someone was using my name, so I came to find out who it was.
1�Hmph. That name isn't cutesy-wutesy at all!

1�Everyone thinky-winks we're so heartless, we're so cruelly-wuel, whatever...but surely-wurely they jest. Of course we're not a bunch of thuggy-wugs! And if you even try to insinuate as much, I'll knocky-wock your face in!
1�The Imperial Army is just as you said...a bunch of namby-pambies.
1�I mean...what about the family-wamilies left behind when the beastmen attack?
1�What about the childy-wildren who lose their fathy-wather in the battles?
1�Who is going to takey-wake revenge for them? The Empire? Empress Nashmeira? No!
1�Do you thinky-wink the powerless are going to get happiness from goldy-wold, laws, or stuffy-wuffy philosophies? No!
1�Especially in Aht Urhgan!
1�I'm just lendy-wending the poor and huddled masses a helping hand!
1�Duuruhn, if you really-weally want to leave the army, we'll take care of you until this all setty-wettles down.
1�Yeppy-weppers! , I'll leavey-weave everything else to you. Go reporty-wort to the Imperial Army...or else, see?
1�Maybe we'll meety-weet again somewhere.
1�I hope we'll be on the same side then. Heh heh!
1�Time for our exit!You too, Duuruhn! Move those leggy-wegs!
1�Well, I am Duuruhn.
1�And everything is my fault...
1�It all began with my doubts regarding the Imperial Army...
1�Yes... I was a soldier of the Imperial Army, but to be honest, I hated the way they did things.
1�The army is supposed to protect the Empire's citizens and ensure the security of its land.
1�But where are they when the beastmen invade Al Zahbi?
1�They use the mercenaries and volunteer soldiers as fodder for the enemy as they watch the battle from afar!
1�I did not want to be part of an army that serves the Empire only in name.
1�Rather than continue my duties with such doubts running through my mind, I opted to desert and find my own path.
1�However, I am still a soldier. I have sworn loyalty to the Empress and know the inner workings of the Empire. They would not simply allow me to quit...
1�That's when I learned of Two Horn.
1�Nobody knows who Two Horn is, so I used the rumors of his existence to disappear.
1�Please forget you ever saw me here.
1�I beg you... Tell my officer that Two Horn didn't exist after all, and that my life was taken by the beastmen.
1�What!?
1�So you've been causing all those incidents...?
1�R-really?
1�Y-yes, ma'am!
1�Heh heh. Surely ya can't expect us to keep count o' the number of people the boss 'as passed 'er merciless judgments on.
1�Ya better not anger da boss.
1�Ya better pray you are!
1�The name ??Two Horn?? comes from 'er pigtails seen by 'er shudderin' victims as she leaves 'em in 'er wake.
1�She's gonna continue cleanin' up da streets, ya know.
1�Later!
s.�You are unable to log anythin
s!�You successfully cut off  $???
1�Your #???? break
?!�You cut off  $????, but your #???? breaks in the proces
g.�You cannot carry any more items. Your inventory is ful
!?�Mikilulu! She's-- I've-- It's-- We've-- Toad!
1�You see, you two were still sleeping when I recovered from the spell. I looked around to see if I couldn't spot the fiend that had put us in this predicament...
1�...when I saw my precious Mikilulu...
1�...being turned into a frog!
1�Anyway, I tried my best to catch my poor sweetheart, but she was just too slick and slimy.
1�And before I knew it, I found myself in the middle of the forest. Miki had stopped near a tree and I was just about to sneak up and grab her...
1�...when I saw her jump towards a shadow that was probably a terrible monster! It was a Poroggo, I tell you!
s!�Mikimiki! Why did you go and run away from your Salwa? You don't know how worried I was!
1�So, Professor. Now all we have to do is wait for the spell to wear off naturally, right?
1�Gwahhh!
u!�You did it! Now Miki will...
1�What the...?
1�Then if this is really Miki, and that is really the culprit, then why is she still a toad!?
1�But what about waiting for the spell to wear off? You said that would work, right?
1�Wh-what!? That can't be!
1�Wait a minute... Are you trying to say that my girl has always been a frog!?
1�P-Professor! Let me help you!
1�I'll do anything!I mean, I don't know much about zoology, but there's got to be something I can do!
1�Discipline is my middle name! I won't let you down!
1�T-Thanks B! I...uh, mean, thank you very much, Your Professing Greatness.
1�N-none at all, sir!
1�Alright, Miki. Let's go back to the kind professor's lab, where I'll build you a nice, big cage with grass and rocks and...
1�Oh, and I bet you'll be wanting to take a swim every now and then.
1�Well, you don't have to worry about that. Just croak and I'll dig you your very own swamp, with lily pads and everything!
1�And food! I'll get you whatever you're craving for! What are you craving for? Worms? No, wait moles like worms... What do toads like again? Bugs! That's right!
1�If it's bugs you want, bugs you'll get! I've got a Mog Locker full of shell bugs from that last time I tried to grow some ore.
1�That's right, Miki. I'll be right by your side until the big B can find a way to turn you back to normal.
1�And then...
1�We can get married and live happily ever after!
1�M-Mikilulu!
1�You... You understood what I was saying the whole time?
1�Wow... So, all this time you were a frog, you were still thinking of me?
1�I'm sorry, Mikilulu. This is all my fault. If I hadn't made you worry about me being transmutrified into a toad, you wouldn't have had to go through all this.
1�But never again! From now on, I'll protect you from anything that stands in the way of our love...
1�...as soon as I finish this job for Professor Clavauert!
1�Eh? You're not going through with the experiment? But what about your research? What about my paycheck!?
1�And... Um... So does this mean I still get my paycheck...?
1�Th-thank you!
1�I don't know. She didn't tell me...I can only guess it was because she was worried about the experiment.
1�Oh! Why did it have to be Miki!? I was the one that was supposed to be transformed!
1�How scared she must be...
1�Well, after what seemed like hours of chasing, the Poroggo finally ducked away into this cave...
1�...and that's when I lost him...
1�I thought about searching for the frogman myself, but this place is crawling with hungry-looking Mamool Ja, and I wasn't planning on being a snack for those snakes.
1�But how, Professor?
1�Professor! I think I can tell which one is my Miki!
1�I mean, I did chase her through the forest for almost an hour.
1�But even so, I'd know my own fiancee anywhere--frog or not!
1�I-- No... I haven't!
1�Whoa!I guess that's why they call you ??Professor??!
1�But...This place is huge. Where do we start looking?
1�That's all I wanted to hear, Salwa.
1�No, not the whole time.
1�But for some reason, those last few words of yours rang out in my head...
1�...and before I knew it, I was back to my old self!
1�Salwa...
1�Well, if it isn't Salwa-Molwa...
1�  and I were just about to set off in search of you.
1�However, it seems that you, in turn, have found us. All's well that ends well, I suppose.
1�Now, why don't you calm down and explain to us what has befallen you...starting with that unfortunate occurrence in Wajaom.
1�(You must have the eyes of a pugil,  . His account of the events is absolutely nothing like what you claim to have seen!)
i.�So it was just as you explained,  .
t!�And exactly the same shape as the last! I feel we are getting close...
1�And here is another!
1�But this one is considerably larger... No doubt from the Poroggo that abducted the poor Mikilulu. This suggests that they are still traveling together.
!!�I do not see any Poroggo in the area.Hurry! We must capture her while she is alone!
1�Let me make sure her print is the same as the one at the entrance.
1�Yes... A perfect match!
h!�Hmmm... Just as I had feared.
n!�Stop!
1�I do not understand... The spell should have been broken the instant the caster became incapacitated.
!?�Hmmm...The print is the same as the one we saw near Mikilulu's.
1�I also believe I witnessed your lady friend respond to one of the Poroggo's commands during the battle.
1�Finally, you can see that the subject has calmed down quite considerably since her captor's defeat.
1�That, my boy, I cannot say. My data has never failed me before...
1�Yes, and I also said that slaying the caster would break the curse...
1�Let us rethink this from a scientific standpoint, shall we?
1�First of all, it is clear that the tissue mutation is merely a physiological reaction to a particular medium that has been introduced into the victim's body via the sound waves of the frog song.
1�This reaction continues until the whole body is affected, thus reducing him or her to the shape of the assailant.
1�The concept is much similar to that behind the strange liquid medium that transforms its consumer into the shape of a Mamool Ja.
1�Now, whether the sound waves of the frog song actually carry the medium...
1�...or simply act as a catalyst, activating a genetic medium already present in the victim's body, I cannot say.
1�That was to be the focal point of this expedition's research.
1�As for the victim's actions while in the transmogrified state, it seems that one loses the ability of voluntary thought, leaving him susceptible to the will of the caster.
1�We can derive from this that the Poroggo must be sending some type of neural signal directly to the victim's brain.
1�I believe this signal may also affect the medium I spoke of earlier.
1�By taking control of the nervous system, the Poroggo is able to override the victim's natural defenses--in particular, the defenses that prevent foreign mediums from invading the body.
1�The signal also may trigger the spontaneous generation of a new medium in the body by stimulating certain areas of the cerebral cortex.
1�To put it in layman's terms...
1�To maintain the transmogrified state, there must exist a continuous physiological reaction.
1�In other words, the Poroggo must keep sending inhibitor signals to the victim, or the reaction will cease.

1�In theory, maintaining these signals would require extreme levels of concentration. This explains why most victims return to their original state after extended periods of time--when the caster becomes fatigued or distracted.
1�And if we apply these same conclusions, then we can easily explain why defeating the caster would immediately nullify the effects of the song.
1�However, as we can see here, the victim, Mikilulu, remains in the transmogrified state despite the fact her assailant has met his demise.
1�Which suggests that she may not return with the simple passing of time.
1�The potency of the physiological reaction has been known to vary depending on mental condition of the victim. It is possible the song resonated with something deep within Mikilulu's subconscious.
1�While I wouldn't necessarily use those words, yes, one could say that your Mikilulu has more than likely been harboring suppressed ranine tendencies.
1�Though, there may be a more reasonable explanation.

1�For example, if a large portion of Mikilulu's conscious had been dedicated to thinking of, and or, worrying about toads, then her mind may have become dependant on the Poroggo's signal and thus began reproducing it out of necessity when the original signal stopped.
1�In any case, finding a cure will require months, maybe years of new research.
1�I am sorry, Salwa, but you shall just have to wait until then to reunite with your lady friend.
1�But you need not fear, my friend, for I shall dedicate myself to finding a solution to this predicament.
1�You have my word as a scientist!
1�Hmmm...I conduct a very strict program. I require the utmost in discipline from my assistants.
1�But can I trust you...?
1�Alright. You may temporarily join my research team.
1�Now we must hurry back to Al Zahbi and begin conducting tests. Move along, young man! We have little time to waste!
1�Ah, and if I do recall, you have a slight problem with punctuality.
1�That is why I will require you to take up residency in my laboratory's supplies room. Do you have any objections?
1�Amazing!
1�Your services are no longer required, Salwa-Molwa.
1�What are you talking about? The experiment was a success.
1�Let me sum up my theory for you.
1�Your expression of love triggered something within Mikilulu's mind, or should I say heart, thus releasing her from the grasp of the inhibitor signals.
1�This ultimately proves that the duration of the frog song depends less on the potency of the Poroggo's cant, and more on the victim's psychological state.
1�And because we now know that the victim's mind is capable of mimicking the Poroggo inhibitor signal...
1�...we can conclude that the song is merely a catalyst, and it is the victim himself that maintains the actual transmogrification.
1�However, we cannot ignore previous data showing symptoms of the toad curse vanishing upon the death of the caster.
1�Therefore, I shall reconstruct my original theories and continue my research to discover a connection between Poroggo neural activity and transmogrification duration.
1�This expedition has spawned more questions than it has answered, but I did learn one thing...
1�...that the true culprit behind physical transmogrification is the victim himself!
1�If this seemingly subconscious action could somehow be made lucid, then people could transform themselves into whatever shape they dreamed!
1�However, this hypothesis requires much more research before it can be proven. I have much work ahead of me...
1�<Sigh>Of course it does. And I shall even throw in something extra for Mikilulu's part in all this. Come by my office tomorrow morning at nine o-clock sharp...and do not be late!
1�Ah yes, and I suppose you'll be wanting your reward as well. I have entrusted your payment with Maudaal in Whitegate. Speak with him when you return to the city.
1�Now let us be off!
p!�Hmmm... An interesting story...
1�Though one aspect of the tale makes little sense--what was this female acquaintance of yours doing in the Wajaom Woodlands in the first place?
1�Calm down, calm down. Now, tell us what happened next.
1�Understood.We are left with no other choice than to locate and rescue this Mikilulu.
1�My recent studies of Poroggo behavior have led me to the following conclusions regarding the removal of their curses.
1�The first is that the effects of the frog song will simply wear off after time.
1�If we can catch your lady friend, then we need simply wait in a safe location until she returns to normal.
1�The second of my conclusions is a tad more dramatic.
1�In theory, the spell of the frog song can also be broken...
1�...by slaying its caster.
1�While I hope it will not come to this, we may be forced to resort to violence if the Poroggo in question is not as cooperative as we may like.
1�Now, I am a man of science. I could never resort to killing a fellow living creature. That is where you come in,  .
1�Now, as for distinguishing 'your' toad from a more common specimen...
1�Hmmm...While I do not question your feelings towards Mikilulu...
1�...I am wary of basing our search efforts on the memory of a Tarutaru who cannot even remember at which gate he is to convene.
1�If only there were another, more reliable method...
!?�Toadprints! And quite fresh, by my calculations.
1�Salwa, my boy. Have you seen any other toads in the vicinity since arriving?
1�Then by process of elimination, we can deduce that the prints here belong to none other than Mikilulu!
1�You need not worry, son. Poroggo are an amphibious species, meaning they cannot survive long out of water.
1�To the west of our current location lies a small lake that is rumored to be one of their breeding grounds. We shall first try our luck there.
1�And if anything attempts to attack us, I am sure our trusty mercenary here will handle it.
1�Boo-hah-hah?`...kupo!
1�Huh? Why aren't you jumping out of your skin in absolute terror?I would've died of fright, kupo!
1�Here, take this as a testament to your courage.Exchange it for the item your partner received so you can prove that you both reached the goal safely, kupo!
1�Return with the evidence of your success to the moogle in town. Handing over your partner's item will prove that you were both able to reach me, kupo!
1�Oh, and here's a picture of how your partner's face looked when I popped out of nowhere to scare you. You should hand this in at the same time, kupo!Kupupupu...
1�This place is crawling with nasties.You should probably head back to town so you can testify to your partner's bravery.
1�Boo-hah-hah?`...kupo!
1�Why do ghosts say ??boo,?? anyway?
1�I heard that going to a dark, scary dungeon is the best way to test your courage.This place definitely qualifies, kupo!
1�Maybe I'm doing something wrong, kupo?
1�If it gets out that I haven't scared the wits out of a single person yet, I'm going to get into trouble, kupo...
1�Boo-hah-hah?`...kupo!
1�Huh? Why aren't you jumping out of your skin in absolute terror?I would've died of fright, kupo!
1�Here, take this as a testament to your courage.Exchange it for the item your partner received so you can prove that you both reached the goal safely, kupo!

1�If it gets out that I haven't scared the wits out of a single person yet, I'm going to get into trouble, kupo...

1�Why do ghosts say ??boo,?? anyway?
1�I heard that going to a dark, scary dungeon is the best way to test your courage.This place definitely qualifies, kupo!
1�Maybe I'm doing something wrong, kupo?
1�If it gets out that I haven't scared the wits out of a single person yet, I'm going to get into trouble, kupo...
1�Boo-hah-hah?`...kupo!
1�Huh? Why aren't you jumping out of your skin in absolute terror?I would've died of fright, kupo!
1�Here, take this as a testament to your courage.Exchange it for the item your partner received so you can prove that you both reached the goal safely, kupo!
1�Return with the evidence of your success to the moogle in town. Handing over your partner's item will prove that you were both able to reach me, kupo!
1�Oh, and here's a picture of how your partner's face looked when I popped out of nowhere to scare you. You should hand this in at the same time, kupo!Kupupupu...
1�This place is crawling with nasties.You should probably head back to town so you can testify to your partner's bravery.

1�The Voidwatch is a fellowship of men and women come together to defend the world from extradimensional invaders called ??Voidwalkers.?? Driven only by an insatiable appetite for destruction, these fell horrors roam the space between dimensions, ever seeking to enter and plunge Vana'diel into chaos.

1�Faced with the risk of mass invasion, Voidwatch leaders devised a strategy wherein potential threats are preemptively neutralized.This act was made possible through the discovery of voidstones, magicked objects capable of rendering Voidwalkers visible to be summarily dispatched.
1�Such efforts to stem the rise of Voidwalkers, collectively dubbed ??Voidwatch Operations,?? or ??Ops?? for short, take place in the vicinity of planar rifts--weak points in the fabric of space.

1�A single person may initiate a Voidwatch operation, at which time ??Voidwatcher?? status will be bestowed upon all qualifying party and alliance members, allowing them to commence battle with the target Voidwalker.

1�Voidwatch Ops are subject to a time limit. Exceed this limit and Voidwatcher status will be revoked for all involved, bringing the confrontation to an end. Individuals straying too far from the site of battle, too, will find themselves relieved of the status.

1�Know also that those who take on the burden of the Voidwatcher become temporarily isolated and unable to receive aid from the outside world.Such is the arduous nature of transdimensional encounters.
1�Initiating a Voidwatch operation requires a voidstone, as well as a stratum abyssite attuned to a particular planar rift.
1�Only one person needs to be in possession of these objects for all party and alliance members to participate.
1�However, there exists a number of participation conditions that must be observed.

1�When an operation commences, a single voidstone will be expended for all who possess it.These combatants will have the opportunity to improve their spoils by manipulating spectral alignment values during battle.
1�Conversely, those not possessing their own voidstone will be limited in the spoils they can obtain.
1�The ??voidstone?? is a magicked object which, when coupled with stratum abyssite, is capable of rendering Voidwalkers visible.

1�Only a single combatant need possess a voidstone to allow all party and alliance members to participate in a Voidwatch operation.Those without one, however, will find their spoils limited in both quantity and quality.
1�As a single voidstone is automatically expended when the battle commences, it is recommended that you keep stock of your inventory.
1�Those wishing to obtain the stones should speak to a Voidwatch officer, who is charged with issuing a set quantity at fixed intervals.
1�Stratum abyssite are dynamic stones capable of evolution. By absorbing the energies emitted by felled Voidwalkers, they become attuned with other planar rifts.
1�After defeating your quarry, present your stone to an atmacite refiner--specialists in the study of otherworld geology--to have its properties determined.
1�Stratum abyssite growth occurs independently of voidstones, and the latter is not required to trigger development.

1�Each dimension is composed of its own existential spectrum to which objects of that world are aligned. The act of rendering a Voidwalker visible is essentially an act of aligning oneself to its existential spectrum.

1�While Voidwatchers are able to, for all practical purposes, interact with such creatures, they in fact fall short of full alignment. Symptoms of this imperfect state can be observed in the limited quantity and quality of spoils normally yielded by Voidwalkers.

1�Compensating measures, however, exist which allow combatants to more closely attune themselves with their extradimensional foe. One such method involves the use of alignment-enhancing artifacts known as ??ascent items.??
1�Alignment values raised through ascent items will remain in place until such time as a riftworn pyxis is opened at the end of a successful operation.
1�Those participating in Voidwatch Ops are recommended to plan ahead in order to make effective use of ascent items.
1�Alignment values can also be raised in the midst of battle by striking at enemy weaknesses, causing their existential attunement to shift to your advantage.

1�Blows can be dealt with abilities such as weapon skills and magic spells, and your choice of weakness and the manner in which you strike it will determine which hue of the alignment spectrum is affected.
1�The existential spectrum is comprised of five lights (blue, red, yellow, green, and white), each of which influences reward yield.
1�The precise workings of each light can be reviewed when examining your current alignment values.
1�Upon the successful conclusion of battle, the alignment bonus as granted by ascent items and the exploitation of enemy weaknesses are combined to determine the spoils.

1�Be forewarned: Voidwalkers are highly guileful beings and will not suffer the same weakness being struck twice. Combatants must be on constant watch for any changes that may occur during the course of battle.
1�Atmacite is the physical agglomeration of a monster's soul, and a vessel for its feral instincts.By infusing atmacite to one's body using 6????, it is possible to enhance one's battle prowess.
1�Be aware, however, that powers granted by atmacite can be tapped only when engaged in a Voidwatch operation.
1�Atmacite is resilient and will not be expended in the infusion process.
1�Furthermore, infused atmacite will remain in place until voluntarily purged.
1�As the configuration of atmacite is not possible during an operation, be sure to see to your battle preparations ahead of time.
1�Cruor can be used to enrich atmacite, enhancing its potency. The amount of cruor required for enrichment and the resultant properties vary with atmacite.

1�Atmacite can be enriched in stages to a maximum of level 
�.
1�All Voidwatchers are urged to make atmacite enrichment a priority, for they might just mean the difference between life and death.
1�Periapt are lucky charms that grant myriad beneficial effects ranging from improved vitality to general upturns in fortune.
1�Especially sought after are those bestowing temporary items at the commencement of an operation, granting combatants a distinct advantage against the enemy.
1�Although their acquisition can only be described as arduous, the benefits make them well worth the effort.

1�Each dimension is composed of its own existential spectrum to which objects of that world are aligned. The act of rendering a Voidwalker visible is essentially an act of aligning oneself to its existential spectrum.

1�While Voidwatchers are able to, for all practical purposes, interact with such creatures, they in fact fall short of full alignment. Symptoms of this imperfect state can be observed in the limited quantity and quality of spoils normally yielded by Voidwalkers.

1�Compensating measures, however, exist which allow combatants to more closely attune themselves with their extradimensional foe. One such method involves the use of alignment-enhancing artifacts known as ??ascent items.??
1�Alignment values raised through ascent items will remain in place until such time as a riftworn pyxis is opened at the end of a successful operation.
1�Those participating in Voidwatch Ops are recommended to plan ahead in order to make effective use of ascent items.
1�Alignment values can also be raised in the midst of battle by striking at enemy weaknesses, causing their existential attunement to shift to your advantage.

1�Blows can be dealt with abilities such as weapon skills and magic spells, and your choice of weakness and the manner in which you strike it will determine which hue of the alignment spectrum is affected.
1�The existential spectrum is comprised of five lights (blue, red, yellow, green, and white), each of which influences reward yield.
1�The precise workings of each light can be reviewed when examining your current alignment values.
1�Upon the successful conclusion of battle, the alignment bonus as granted by ascent items and the exploitation of enemy weaknesses are combined to determine the spoils.

1�Be forewarned: Voidwalkers are highly guileful beings and will not suffer the same weakness being struck twice. Combatants must be on constant watch for any changes that may occur during the course of battle.
1�Atmacite is the physical agglomeration of a monster's soul, and a vessel for its feral instincts.By infusing atmacite to one's body using 6????, it is possible to enhance one's battle prowess.
1�Be aware, however, that powers granted by atmacite can be tapped only when engaged in a Voidwatch operation.
1�Atmacite is resilient and will not be expended in the infusion process.
1�Furthermore, infused atmacite will remain in place until voluntarily purged.
1�As the configuration of atmacite is not possible during an operation, be sure to see to your battle preparations ahead of time.
1�Cruor can be used to enrich atmacite, enhancing its potency. The amount of cruor required for enrichment and the resultant properties vary with atmacite.

1�Atmacite can be enriched in stages to a maximum of level 
�.
1�All Voidwatchers are urged to make atmacite enrichment a priority, for they might just mean the difference between life and death.
1�Periapt are lucky charms that grant myriad beneficial effects ranging from improved vitality to general upturns in fortune.
1�Especially sought after are those bestowing temporary items at the commencement of an operation, granting combatants a distinct advantage against the enemy.
1�Although their acquisition can only be described as arduous, the benefits make them well worth the effort.
